comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: "Miskinoff" is a misspelling of "Mishkinoff." [Misspelling is Bain's fault this time, not LOC's.] Prince Alex Mishkinoff was an indigent shirttail member of the Russian nobility, who married California railroad heiress Aimee for her wealth. He was her fourth husband. Then he was accused of statutory rape, having had sexual relations with her 15-year-old daughter by a previous marriage. Aimee divorced him. (Then she married one more time.) A lot of juicy details spilled out in court. New York Times story, February 14, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C02E6D8153AE6... LOC has a Bain photo of MRS. Alex Mishkinoff [Aimee], but it has not yet been posted to Flickr: luirig.altervista.org/cpm/albums/bain-29/14421-Mrs--Alex-...
